definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to take in and send out (in large quantities)
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
to hum and haw (idiom); to mumble as if hiding sth/to speak and break off, then start again/to hold sth back
to hum and haw (idiom); to mumble as if hiding sth/to speak and break off, then start again/to hold sth back
to wolf down one's food (idiom); to devour ravenously/to gorge oneself
to swallow clouds and blow out fog (idiom)/to blow cigarette or opium smoke

sentences.english: Take the medicine down and do not stop to think about it.
sentences.chinese: 把药吞下去，吞的时候不要停下来想它。

sentences.english: The thin heads of grain swallowed up the seven healthy, full heads.
sentences.chinese: 这细弱的穗子吞了那七个又肥大又饱满的穗子。

sentences.english: The sword swallower swallowed a swollen sword.
sentences.chinese: 吞剑人吞了一把膨胀的剑。

sentences.english: You look at other media companies without this protection and they've been gobbled up.
sentences.chinese: 你看那些没有这种保护的媒体企业，哪个不给人吞了？

sentences.english: Mr. Wei panic, and he suspected grandson swallowed another cell.
sentences.chinese: 魏先生慌了，他怀疑是孙子吞了另一节电池。

sentences.english: Jimmy swallowed the medicine and made a face.
sentences.chinese: 吉米吞下药后扮了个苦相。

sentences.english: But a hungry heron flew down and swallowed him up for supper.
sentences.chinese: 但一只饥饿的鹭飞下来，把他当晚餐吞了。

sentences.english: He just ate a little fish and took a shot of Kaoliang .
sentences.chinese: 他刚刚吞了一条小鱼，然后喝了一小杯高粱。

sentences.english: It will cut your intestines into pieces if you are foolish enough to swallow me.
sentences.chinese: 如果你愚蠢地吞了我，它就会把你的肠子划成碎片。

sentences.english: Now the LORD had prepared a great fish to swallow up Jonah. And Jonah was in the belly of the fish three days and three nights.
sentences.chinese: 耶和华安排一条大鱼吞了约拿，他在鱼腹中三日三夜。

sentences.english: Only the shepherd is stronger than the roaring lion that seeks to devour us.
sentences.chinese: 惟有牧羊人才强得过那寻找吞吃我们的咆哮狮子。

sentences.english: During the days he held back the tears, but in the night he let them flow.
sentences.chinese: 白天牠的泪水往内吞，晚上牠则让泪水静静地流下来。

sentences.english: Israel is swallowed up: now shall they be among the Gentiles as a vessel wherein is no pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 以色列被吞吃，现今在列国中，好像人不喜悦的器皿。

sentences.english: I just can’t seem to swallow this MDMA.
sentences.chinese: 我似乎吞不下去这个摇头丸。

sentences.english: One day a wolf swallowed a bone because he ate his dinner too fast.
sentences.chinese: 某日，一匹狼因为晚餐吃得太快而吞了一根骨头。

sentences.english: I just lost another 50 cents in this stupid vending machine.
sentences.chinese: 这个破自动售货机又吞了我50美分。

definition: to spit/to send out (silk from a silkworm, bolls from cotton flowers etc)/to say/to pour out (one's grievances)
to open one's mouth (to speak, esp. to make a request)/to gape
big mouthful (of food, drink, smoke etc)/open mouth/gulping/gobbling/gaping
to breathe/to suck in/to absorb/to inhale
to open one's mouth (to eat, speak etc)/to gape/to start talking (esp. to make a request)
to sip/to smack one's lips/to taste/to savor
